issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The code related to this issue is being reviewed by engineering
status.name: In Review

fields.description: The newer euca2ools commands available as of Eucalyptus 4.2.0 (euca2ools 3.3.0) aren't getting captured by the current eucalyptus-sos-plugins package.
fields.summary: eucalyptus-sos-plugins needs to be updated to include newer euca2ools commands (eucafrontend)

comments.body:
Did some testing, seeing the new goodness I was expecting to see.

Does this require further QA testing before publishing to the public repo?

I just realized that I've overlooked using euctl to explicitly dump authentication.ldap_integration_configuration (in the same way euctl is being used to dump cloud.network.network_configuration).

I'll get working on that.

Edit: Just now added [this commit|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-sosreport-plugins/commit/cfdbb1cce59f039c025449132b483c1c8e0cc058].

Please let me know when the RPM has been rebuilt internally, and I'll test it out.

Commits to maint-4.2 and master (git log):

{noformat}
commit cfdbb1cce59f039c025449132b483c1c8e0cc058
Author: quadespresso <jim.carroll@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 15 13:22:00 2016 -0500

    Added explicit collection of LDAP config via euctl

    Added the same collection of
    authentication.ldap_integration_configuration as exists for
    cloud.network.network_configuration.

commit 8edb3a53b2190934139bd98a823d712cdb32b7b4
Author: quadespresso <jim.carroll@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 12 16:28:30 2016 -0600

    Moved tracking of /var/run/eucalyptus

    Moved tracking of /var/run/eucalyptus from eucanode to eucacore.

commit 209ba983e1a958abb812c880eba93bb95488f8c0
Author: Harold Spencer Jr <hspencer77@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 11 15:47:24 2016 -0500

    Update README.md

    make rpm to bdist_rpm

Author: Teemu Jalonen <teemu.jalonen@iki.fi>

    make rpm to bdist_rpm

    make rpm did not yield rpm package. python setup.py bdist_rpm works

Author: Teemu Jalonen <teemu.jalonen@iki.fi>

    tools.repo is the old place, release repo has newer version

Author: quadespresso <jim.carroll@eucalyptus.com>

    Added support for more euca2ools commands, as well as the GNI on the NC
    side.

commit 9d3678adc265ced51a8581d9111182077b0f462a

Date:   Thu Jan 14 18:33:35 2016 -0600

    Files such as the GNI and nc-stats.
{noformat}

Eucalyptus Version:  {{4.2.2-0.24187.20.20160329git4b58c04.el6}}
Eucalyptus-Sos-Plugin Version: {{0.2.2-0.218.6.20160415gitcfdbb1c.el6}}
OS Version: {{CentOS release 6.7 (Final)}}
Sosreport Version: {{sosreport (version 3.2)}}

eucalyptus-sos-plugins seems to have issues obtaining credentials.  All files complained about not finding credentials.  For example:
{code}
[root@c-31 tmp]# cat sosreport-QA.EUCA11756-20160419130927/sos_commands/eucafrontend/euctl-cloud.network.network_configuration.json
euctl: error: missing access key ID; please supply one with -I
[root@c-31 tmp]# cat sosreport-QA.EUCA11756-20160419130927/sos_commands/eucafrontend/euwatch-describe-alrms-v
euwatch-describe-alarms: error (403 Forbidden): Failed to find access key
{code}

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus multi-cluster cloud with Eucalyptus DNS enabled - [hspencer-309|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/309/]
# Created non-eucalyptus account
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl system
system.dns.dnsdomain = d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
system.dns.nameserver = nshost.localhost
system.dns.nameserveraddress = 10.111.1.125
system.dns.registrationid = 67b7e6c7-7ee8-4be4-9b28-fd4a9caa5e89
system.exec.io_chunk_size = 102400
system.exec.max_restricted_concurrent_ops = 2
system.exec.restricted_concurrent_ops = dd,gunzip,tar
{code}
# Create signed cert for UFS, and configure HTTPS endpoints (DOC-1699)
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.ssl.server_alias=rick-ross
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.ssl.server_password=rickross
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.port=443 
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_ec2_uri_scheme=https
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_euare_uri_scheme=https
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_s3_uri_scheme=https
{code}
# Enable DNS spoofing 
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl dns.spoof_regions.enabled=true
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions=true
[root@c-31 ~]# euctl dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions=true
{code}
# Installed latest version of eucalyptus-sos-plugins package:
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# yum install eucalyptus-sos-plugins -y --nogpgcheck
.....
Downloading Packages:
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.2.2-0.218.6.20160415gitcfdbb1c.el6.noarch.rpm                                                                                            |  28 kB     00:00
Running rpm_check_debug
Running Transaction Test
Transaction Test Succeeded
Running Transaction

  Cleanup    : eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.2.2-0.218.4.20160315gitcfdbb1c.el6.noarch                                                                                                    2/2

  Verifying  : eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.2.2-0.218.4.20160315gitcfdbb1c.el6.noarch                                                                                                    2/2

Updated:
  eucalyptus-sos-plugins.noarch 0:0.2.2-0.218.6.20160415gitcfdbb1c.el6

Complete!

[root@c-31 ~]# yum list eucalyptus-sos-plugins
Installed Packages
eucalyptus-sos-plugins.noarch                                                  0.2.2-0.218.6.20160415gitcfdbb1c.el6                                                   @eucalyptus-release
{code}
# Ran sosreport using only 'eucafrontend' plugin:
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# sosreport -o eucafrontend -v --ticket-number=9999 --name=QA --case-id=EUCA11756

Check out the latest build [here|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/centos/6/x86_64/?C=M;O=D]. Lots of updates.

In particular, note that the version number has been updated to 0.3.0.

I believe I've tackled the credentials issue. Tested scenarios included:

* no credentials sourced
* sourced admin eucarc (deprecated but tested for conflicts)
* default euca2ools.ini profile

I've also added support for [~gholms]'s newest command {{euserv-describe-events}}.

Git log comments:

{code}
commit da16f490c8c7b9fcc9c731fb1b775272870a4cab

    E.g., /var/run/eucalyptus/classcache was excessive.
